quiz.title: Chemistry Grade 10: Unit 11 Quiz 10
quiz.subtitle: 11.10: End of Year Exam Preparation
quiz.subject: Chemistry
quiz.topic: Final exam techniques and practice assessment

questions.question: Which of the following describes the role of a catalyst in a chemical reaction?
options: It lowers the activation energy required for the reaction to occur
It increases the total amount of product that can be formed
It is completely consumed during the reaction and must be replaced
It shifts the chemical equilibrium to favor the formation of more product
questions.explanation: A catalyst provides an alternative reaction pathway with lower activation energy, speeding up the reaction without being consumed.

questions.question: If $2.0$ moles of $\text{SO}_2$ react with excess $\text{O}_2$ to form $\text{SO}_3$, how many moles of $\text{SO}_3$ are produced?
questions.explanation: According to the balanced equation $2\text{SO}_2 + \text{O}_2 \rightarrow 2\text{SO}_3$, the molar ratio of $\text{SO}_2$ to $\text{SO}_3$ is $1:1$, so $2.0$ moles produce $2.0$ moles.

questions.question: What is the pH of a solution where the hydrogen ion concentration $[\text{H}^+]$ is $1.0 \times 10^{-7}$ M?
questions.explanation: pH is calculated as the negative log of the hydrogen ion concentration: $\text{pH} = -\log[H^+]$; the negative log of $10^{-7}$ is exactly $7$ (neutral).

questions.question: Which chemical bond type is formed by the sharing of electron pairs between two nonmetals?
questions.explanation: Covalent bonds occur when atoms share valence electrons to achieve stable electron configurations, typical of nonmetal-nonmetal bonds.

questions.question: In the greenhouse effect, what property allows $\text{CO}_2$ to trap heat in the atmosphere?
options: It absorbs infrared radiation and re-emits it back toward the Earth
It reflects all incoming solar ultraviolet light back into deep space
It chemically reacts with nitrogen to release thermal energy to air
It increases the density of the air preventing warm air from rising
questions.explanation: Greenhouse gases are transparent to visible light but absorb longer-wavelength infrared radiation (heat) leaving the Earth.

questions.question: During the water treatment process, what is the specific function of the coagulation step?
options: Neutralizing particle charges so they clump together into larger flocs
Using chlorine to kill microorganisms and prevent waterborne diseases
Removing dissolved calcium and magnesium ions to soften the supply
Filtering the water through layers of activated carbon for odors
questions.explanation: Coagulation involves adding chemicals like alum to neutralize charges, allowing tiny suspended particles to aggregate into larger masses.

questions.question: What is the molar mass of Calcium Carbonate ($\text{CaCO}_3$)? (Ca=$40$, C=$12$, O=$16$)
questions.explanation: The molar mass is calculated by summing the atomic masses: $40 + 12 + (3 \times 16) = 100$ grams per mole.

questions.question: Which type of chemical reaction is represented by: $\text{Zn} + \text{CuSO}_4 \rightarrow \text{ZnSO}_4 + \text{Cu}$?
questions.explanation: Zinc is more reactive than copper and displaces the copper ion from the sulfate compound, a classic single displacement.

questions.question: What is the primary characteristic of a saturated solution?
options: It contains the maximum amount of solute that can dissolve at that temperature
It has been heated until all of the liquid solvent has evaporated away
It can still dissolve a significantly large amount of additional solute
It contains only nonpolar molecules dissolved in a polar solvent
questions.explanation: Saturation is the point at which the solvent can no longer dissolve any additional solute under current temperature and pressure.

questions.question: Which gas is considered a primary contributor to the formation of acid rain?
questions.explanation: Sulfur dioxide reacts with atmospheric moisture and oxygen to form sulfuric acid, which is a major component of acid rain.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You are fully prepared for the final unit exam.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! You have a solid grasp of the core concepts in Unit 11.
scoreMessages.50: Keep studying. Review your stoichiometry and acid-base calculations.
scoreMessages.0: Let's go back through the unit modules to strengthen your understanding.
